statement.p: Bruce buys a 50-pound bag of rice and consumes about 0.4 pounds per week. Write an expression for the amount of rice, R, Bruce has left in terms of the number of weeks, w, since he bought the bag.
Delbert is offered a job as a salesman. He will be paid $1000 per month plus a 6% commission on his sales. Write an expression for Delbert's monthly income, I, in terms of his sales, S.

Frank plants a dozen corn seedlings, each 6 inches tall. With plenty of water and sunlight they will grow approximately 2 inches per day. Complete the table of values for the height, h, of the seedlings after t days.

li.p: Complete the table of values for the height, h of the seedlings after t days.
Write an equation for the height, h, of the seedlings in terms of the number of days, t, since they were planted.

statement.p: On October 31, Betty and Paul fill their 250-gallon oil tank for their heater. Beginning in November they use an average of 15 gallons of oil per week.

li.p: Complete the table of values for the amount of oil, A, left in the tank after w weeks.
Write an equation that expresses the amount of oil, A, in terms of the number of weeks, w, since October 31.
Graph the equation.
How much did the amount of fuel oil in the tank decrease between the third week and the eighth week? Illustrate this amount on the graph.
During which weeks will the tank contain more than 175 gallons of fuel oil? Illustrate on the graph.
Write and solve an inequality to verify your answer to part (e).

statement.p: The taxi out of Dulles Airport charges a traveler with one suitcase an initial fee of $2.00, plus $1.50 for each mile traveled. Complete the table of values showing the charge, C, for a trip of n miles.

li.p: Write an equation for the charge, C, in terms of the number of miles traveled, n.
Graph the equation.
